title.narrative: The Law on Water Pollution Control

description.narrative:
The project aims to advocate for the Law on Water Pollution Control through consultation workshops with policy makers and experts from the National Assembly, governmental agencies, and other stakeholders.
Specific objectives of the three workshops are: 1. Objective 1: To engage and inform the NA members about the legal initiative on the Law on WPC, and to mobilize feedbacks/suggestions on the advocacy process. 2. Objective 2: To discuss on practical challenges from reality in the implementation of WPC in Da Nang and other provinces at local level, and provide recommendations on effective water resources quality protection solutions to achieve Da Nang's environmental objectives and recommendations on the policies required by the Law on WPC to ensure the Law is implemented effectively at the local level. 3. Objective 3: To discuss and obtain recommendations from policy makers, NA members, and national experts on necessary policies and tools as a foundation to the development of an effective and feasible Law on WPC.
Main outcome: The document on the Law on Water Pollution Control is completed taking into consideration of suggestions and recommendations from policy makers and other experts. The document will be sent to the NA members during the NA meeting in October 2017 and will be used by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment as reference in developing the proposal on the Law on Water Pollution Control or in amending current regulations.

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Environmental and Commun Research

Centre for Environmental and Community Research (CECR) is a Vietnamese non-governmental organization (VNGO) based in Ha Noi. Established in 2009, CECR believes that solutions for present environmental issues need implementing in local areas. These solutions must be developed and adpoted by citizens, resulting in the change in attitude and behaviour of community and individuals towards positive enviroment protection. CECR works with other Clean Water Coalition's members, such as Centre for Environment and Community Development (CECoD), Tây B#c University. Oxfam partly funds and supports in technical aspect for Clean Water Coalition. CECR represents Clean Water Coalition to receive fund and register with relating authorities.
